jsavStuff: var initJSAV = function () {var jsav = new JSAV('jsav');jsav.recorded();var bt = jsav.ds.binarytree({center: true, visible: true, nodegap: 15});bt.root(14);var rt = bt.root();rt.left(2);rt.left().left(1);rt.left().right(3);rt.right(11);rt.right().left(10);rt.right().left().left(7);rt.right().right(30);rt.right().right().left(40);bt.layout();}

question.problem: Which of these inputs will cost the most for Shellsort when using divide-by-twos increments on an array with a size where n is a power of 2?
answers: An array where even positions store values 1 to n/2 and odd positions store values n/2+1 to n.
